quote: A designer knows he has achieved perfection not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
Too many men are afraid of being fools.
The mind is not a vessel to be filled but a fire to be kindled.
There is only a finger's difference between a wise man and a fool.
There is nothing impossible to him who will try.
Such is the audacity of man, that he hath learned to counterfeit Nature, yea, and is so bold as to challenge her in her work.
The depth of darkness to which you can descend and still live is an exact measure of the height to which you can aspire to reach.
Hope is the pillar that holds up the world. Hope is the dream of a waking man.
Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
If you want to build a ship, donâ€™t drum up the men to gather wood, divide the work and give orders. Instead, teach them to yearn for the vast and endless sea.
Do not hire a man who does your work for money, but him who does it for love of it.
The master has failed more times than the beginner has even tried.
The true delight is in the finding out rather than in the knowing.
If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
Where there is no structure, there is no substance.
It is futile to do with more things that which can be done with fewer.
Logic is the most useful tool of all the arts. Without it no science can be fully known.
Software is like sex: it's better when it's free.
One of my most productive days was throwing away 1,000 lines of code.
Programming is the art of telling another human being what one wants the computer to do.
Mathematics is not about numbers, equations, computations, or algorithms: it is about understanding.
The essence of mathematics lies in its freedom.
God does arithmetic.
Information: the negative reciprocal value of probability.
He who loves practice without theory is like the sailor who boards ship without a rudder and compass and never knows where he may cast.
The greater the difficulty, the more glory in surmounting it.

The competent programmer is fully aware of the strictly limited size of his own skull; therefore he approaches the programming task in full humility, and among other things he avoids clever tricks like the plague.
The beginning of wisdom is the definition of terms.
Those who say it cannot be done should not interrupt those doing it.
In questions of science, the authority of a thousand is not worth the humble reasoning of a single individual.
Only passions, great passions can elevate the soul to great things.
I am putting myself to the fullest possible use, which is all I think that any conscious entity can ever hope to do.
In a closed society where everybody's guilty, the only crime is getting caught. In a world of thieves, the only final sin is stupidity.
The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
source: William Shakespeare, As You Like It

quote: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.

We have now sunk to a depth at which restatement of the obvious is the first duty of intelligent men. If liberty means anything at all, it means the right to tell people what they do not want to hear. In times of universal deceit, telling the truth will be a revolutionary act.
